column3: A Deep Dive into React Hooks
column7:
React Hooks have revolutionized how we write components. They let us use state and other React features without writing a class.

In this post, we'll explore some of the most common hooks like `useState`, `useEffect`, and `useContext`.

We will also look at how to create our own custom hooks to encapsulate and reuse stateful logic. This is a powerful pattern that can make your code much cleaner and easier to reason about.

column3: The Art of Styling with Tailwind CSS
column7:
Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build custom designs without ever leaving your HTML.

Some developers are skeptical at first, seeing the long list of classes as messy. However, once you get used to the workflow, it becomes incredibly productive.

Let's build a few components together and see how Tailwind's mobile-first approach and flexible customization options can speed up your development process significantly.

Static site generators (SSGs) are not a new concept, but they have seen a massive resurgence in popularity.

With the rise of the Jamstack architecture, developers are moving away from monolithic server-rendered applications towards pre-built static sites served over a CDN.

This approach offers better performance, higher security, and lower cost of scaling. In this article, we'll explore the ecosystem of modern SSGs and discuss why they are a great choice for many types of websites.
